Yesterday I visited our family in Ijdabia. I met with elders of the Moroccan tribes. Talk about the problem in the Red Valley and the elections and the needs of the region.
I have visited Ijdabia yesterday and met with Magarba leaders. We discussed the blockage of the coastal road, elections and area needs.
I met yesterday with the local council of the city of Ijdabia and discussed the city's urgent needs, especially the infrastructure projects. The Cabinet approved some 4,000 projects
I have met with local council of Ijdabia and we discussed some of their immediate needs in infrastructure. Cabinet has approved these early.
@__Mortzaq I did offer them solutions for the mines clearing and rebuilding of the destroyed homes. We have allocated budgets for these.
The main demand of the Red Valley protesters is to settle the number of seats in the National Conference for the three "provinces" or to prevent the elections. Which is the people's demand.
